document_data.caption: A [[stegosaurus]] defends itself from a [[pteranodon]] and a ceratosaur.
document_data.name: Ceratosaur
document_data.mainbody: '''Ceratosaurs''', or ceratosauruses ({{Pronounce|ser|æh|to|SAR|us|refs={{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|25}}|audio=Ceratosaurus.ogg}}), also known as '''horned lizards''', were vicious bipedal carnivorous [[dinosaur]]s from the jungles of [[Chult]], also known as '''horn lizards''' of the [[Malatran Plateau]].
document_data.Description: These dinosaurs could reach 30 feet (nine meters) in length and walked on two thick, muscular legs. Their body and tail were proportionally large. They had a curved neck with a lizard-like head, which had a distinctive nose horn and brow ridges and knobby bumps above their over-sized eyes. Their arms were tiny with four clawed fingers each.
document_data.Behavior: Ceratosaurs hunted either alone or in pairs. If in pairs, one would intentionally drive prey into the clutches of the other.
document_data.Combat: Ceratosaurs used their speed and powerful jaws to their advantage. If they caught a creature in their mouths, they would shake it violently.
document_data.History:
Ceratosaurs, like most dinosaurs, originated in Chult.

No one had ever successfully tamed a ceratosaur.
